lines.text:
[At door to hotel]
Darling, are you gonna carry me over the threshold?

[Arms full of luggage]
I can't baby. I've got all these other bags. C'mon.

[Writing check]
Elizabeth Brush Cartwright. How large a donation do you want, Elizabeth?
$50 will keep my nursery babies in milk for a month.
Get awfully mildewed won't they?
How do you like that? I feel like a cheap novel in a circulating library.
I'm changing my will. I've found a new way to beat the inheritance tax. I'm leaving everything to the government.
That's what the FBI gets for being so nosy.
I was in love myself, once - many times!
I've got a floating kidney.
You have?
Yes. I got it in '29 when Columbia Gas hit $7.00 a share.
Of course, the honeymoon couple. I'm sure you'll like our bridal suite. Wonderful view of the Potomac. Although so few of the occupants notice.

[Reading bills]
Valet service, cleaning and pressing, $46! What do you dames do to get your clothes so dirty? What are you, commandos?
I'm on to fish.
Tonight in my village, there will be dancing in the street!
Tonight in my village, we'll be sleeping in the street.
Why didn't we get married before we left New York? Why Maryland?
Because it's more romantic eloping like this.
Eloping from what? What's stopping us? You're an orphan and my family disowned me for voting Democratic!
You can tell we're in Washington now, Arthur. Look at all the brass hats!

[chuckles]
Brass hats? Vivian, those are cuspidors.
